div.div: You may now order your copy of the 2019-2020 Yearbook. Please use this link... http://crabtree-photography.hhimagehost.com/20192020UnionCityJrSrYearbook This link will be open through May!

Children, age 5 before August 1, 2020, may sign up for Kindergarten by clicking on this link... https://forms.gle/H667ZRapEHta2KTs9 , filling in their information, and submitting it to the school. Official school registration and testing information will be sent out at a later date. If you have any ...

a.span: Alternative Classroom "Brings the Heat" and More

div.a: Alternative Classroom "Brings the Heat" and More

div.div: UCJSHS began a new educational program on campus this fall semester. The Alternative Classroom (AC) helps students who have been facing behavioral, academic, and social challenges that have put them behind on their path to graduation. The AC utilizes a variety of unique learning environments to help...

a.span: Two UCJSHS Students Named Top Finalists for Lilly Scholarship

div.a: Two UCJSHS Students Named Top Finalists for Lilly Scholarship

div.div: The Community Foundation of Randolph County (CFRC) has named Union City's Katie Reichard and Derick Williams as two of the top 5 finalists for the 2020 Lilly Endowment Community Scholarship Program. Katie and Derick will be interviewed individually on October 14 by the scholarship committee.&n...

a.span: Katie Reichard Wins State FFA Proficiency

div.a: Katie Reichard Wins State FFA Proficiency

div.div: Future Farmers of America (Indiana) named Katie Reichard as the Winner of the Indiana FFA Poultry Production Proficiency. Students who have Supervised Agriculture Experience (SAE) Projects compete in the Proficiency Program. Katie has raised chickens and other small animals for 4-H Proje...

a.span: Small Town Kid Fights for Agriculture in Washington, D.C.

div.a: Small Town Kid Fights for Agriculture in Washington, D.C.

div.div: The National Farmers Union held the Congressional Fly-In Program from September 8-11. Agriculturalists from across the country spoke with legislators on the issues facing the Ag Industry. The National Farmers Union invited Derick Williams of Union City High School to represent the State of Ind...

a.span: UCJSHS Students of the Month - April and May

div.a: UCJSHS Students of the Month - April and May

div.div: Congratulations to our April and May Students of the Month. April selections were Sylaris Denney and Kyle Buckingham. May selections were Hanna Denney and Noah New.

a.span: UCJSHS Spotlight Artist of the Month - May

div.a: UCJSHS Spotlight Artist of the Month - May

div.div: Congratulations to Lydia Baldwin for being the focus of the March UCJSHS Artist Spotlight! Lydia is a very hard-working individual whose excellent compositional skills and eye for color brought home a 1st place ribbon at the recent Randolph County Student Art Show! Click Here to learn more about our...

span.strong: North Side Elementary School (grades K-6) Registration

br.br:
Registration for grades 1-6:
July 23 - 1:00-7:00 p.m.
July 24 - 1:00-7:00 p.m.
July 25 - 9:00 a.m. - 3:00 p.m.
Children, age 5 before August 1, 2019, can register for Kindergarten at North Side Elementary School. Please bring your child’s birth certificate, social security card, immunization records, and custody papers (if applicable). If you have any questions, please call the North Side School Office at 765-964-6430.
All 3rd-grade parents/guardians are invited to visit the Randolph County PROMISE table at registration. This exciting initiative is designed to increase your child's school success. Every third grader will be involved, but your signature is needed. Don't miss out on this opportunity designed especially for your child!
Registration Documents:
Returning Student (grades 1-6) Registration Forms
New Student (grades 1-6) Registration Forms
New Student (Kindergarten) Registration Forms
North Side (grades K-6) Supply Lists
Parents of students entering K-6 grade should come to registration at the North Side office and be prepared to complete or turn in registration forms and pay book rental fees. Credit/Debit cards will be accepted for payment of fees.*
Union City Jr/Sr High School (grades 7-12) Registration
Registration for grades 7-12:
July 24 - 12:00-7:00 p.m.
July 25 - 12:00-7:00 p.m.
Registration Documents:
Returning Student Registration Forms
New Student Registration Forms
7th and 8th Grade Supply Lists
High School Supply Lists
Parents of students entering 7-12 grade should come to registration at the Jr/Sr High School office and be prepared to complete registration forms and pay book rental and consumables fees. Credit/debit cards will be accepted for payment of fees.*
*Even if a family is approved for free and reduced lunches and book rental fees, parents should be prepared to pay consumables fees. Credit/Debit cards will be accepted for payment of fees.
Family Application for Free and Reduced Meals (English) - only one application per family is needed.
Family Application for Free and Reduced Meals (Spanish)
Randolph Eastern Schools will open for all students in grades K-12 on August 7, 2019.
Please contact the appropriate school's office if you have any questions.
North Side Elementary School - (765) 964-6430
Union City Jr/Sr High School - (765) 964-4840
Superintendent of Schools - (765) 964-4994
Other Information:
The daily schedule for each building during the 2019-2020 school year is:
North Side Elementary: 8:10 a.m. - 3:05 p.m.
Union City Junior/Senior High School: 8:10 a.m. - 3:10 p.m.
ALL SCHOOLS WILL DISMISS AT 2:35 P.M. EVERY WEDNESDAY.
BOOK RENTAL
Grade K $ 77.50
Grade 1 $ 97.00
Grade 2 $ 81.00
Grade 3 $ 87.50
Grade 4 $ 93.50
Grade 5 $ 93.00
Grade 6 $ 77.00
Grade 7 $121.34
Grade 8 $103.36
High School books and fees will be on a per-student basis according to individual classes. Book fees are due at time of registration.
LUNCH COST:
$2.00 K-6
$2.25 7-12
$3.00 Adult
BREAKFAST COST:
$1.25 Breakfast (Grades K-12)
$1.50 Adult Breakfast

li.div: Vision Statement RESC will inspire, instruct, and support our students as they develop into responsible, productive citizens.

div.span:
Randolph Eastern School Corporation's Mission: Reaching, Educating and Supporting our Community
The Randolph Eastern School Corporation does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability or ae in its program or activities. Inquires may be directed to the superintendent's office at 731 N. Plum Street, Union City, IN 47390; (765) 964-4994.
